titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lucy Maynard Salmon Historical Materials Collection, 1690-1982 (bulk 1790-1899)
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Vassar College Archives and Special Collections

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2008.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Lucy Maynard Salmon Historical Materials Collection
did.physdesc: 8 cubic feet (20 boxes); 3 map case folders

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: An artificial collection of letters, diaries, account books, land grants, deeds, wills, and other historical materials originally established by the History Department at Vassar College.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Vassar College History Department founded the Lucy Maynard Salmon Historical Materials Collection in honor of Lucy Maynard Salmon, a professor in the History Department shortly after her death in 1927. The History Department asked students and alumnae to find historical materials among their families' papers to donate to the collection. Articles were published in The Vassar Quarterly to advertise the creation of the collection and to appeal to students and alumnae for historical items. This collection was proposed as a source for students in Vassar's history classes, as a safe repository for documents, and to increase a "historical sense" among students who donated the documents and objects. This collection was originally proposed as an American history project and excluded all material since 1880, but several documents and objects come from Europe and have been from the period after 1880.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: An artificial collection of letters, diaries, account books, land grants, deeds, wills, and other historical materials originally established by the History Department at Vassar College. Includes the Bullard Papers containing letters, charter, petition, bills, receipts, and maps (Dedham, Mass.) relating to the Charles River Meadows Corporation in Massachusetts, 1763-1876; letters of Charles Hawley, 1857-1866, concerning the life of a student at Hamilton College and of a young lawyer in upper New York State; journal of Francis E. Pyle concerning the life of a small shopkeeper in a Pennsylvania village, 1860-1861; typescript copy of the account book of the Rowley family; letters, accounts, and other records of the Williams family of Ithaca, N.Y., 1838-1898; photocopies of letters of Samuel Sawyer, a lawyer of Missouri, 1836-1846; letters of William Galbreath, 1861-1865; and public records of Elizabeth, N.J., 1774-1778.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

p.archref: The Jasper Parish Papers, originally given to be part of the Salmon Historical Collection, were processed and housed separately.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, August 2008. Last updated by Emma Gronbeck, January 2024.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original processing date unknown. Updated by Elizabeth Clarke, August 2007.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection given by Vassar College History Department and various donors in honor of Lucy Maynard Salmon.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lucy Maynard Salmon Historical Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: Series I. Atwater Photographs and Daguerreotypes,

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Abbie S. Blanchard and her sisters, Alice and Clara, were the daughters of Christopher C. Blanchard and his wife, Sally. The family lived in South Weymouth, Massachusetts, in the second half of the nineteenth century. Mr. Blanchard conducted a boot and shoe business, W.and C. Blanchard, in Massachusetts and New Orleans. Abbie and Clara attended Dean Academy in Franklin, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of a diary kept by Abbie S. Blanchard while attending Dean Academy in Franklin, Massachussetts, along with her sister Clara. The diary discusses Blanchard's dissatisfaction with school rules, etiquette lectures, social life with other students, visits home, dancing lesson, and young men. Also includes other miscellaneous family papers.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated to the Lucy Maynard Salmon Collection of Historical Materials, Vassar College Library, by Mary Louise Hukill (VC 1945-4).
